name: Everest Base Camp Trek
description: The iconic trek to the base of the world's highest peak, Mt. Everest. Offers stunning views of Everest, Lhotse, Nuptse, Ama Dablam, and Sherpa culture within Sagarmatha National Park.
historical_significance: Follows historic mountaineering routes; deep immersion in Sherpa Buddhist culture.
itinerary: Day 8: Trek Gorak Shep, Visit EBC
Day 9: Hike Kala Patthar, Trek Pheriche

cost_breakdown.permits: Sagarmatha NP (NPR 3000), Khumbu Municipality Fee (NPR 2000). TIMS often included by agencies.

transportation: Flight Ktm-Lukla (~$400+ RT). Trek from Jiri/Salleri possible (adds 5-7 days).
required_permits: Khumbu Pasang Lhamu Rural Municipality Fee

name: Annapurna Circuit Trek
description: Classic trek encircling the Annapurna massif, famed for its diverse scenery from subtropical to high alpine and arid zones. Crosses the high Thorong La pass.
historical_significance: Follows ancient trade routes; passes diverse ethnic villages (Gurung, Thakali, Manangi) and Muktinath.
itinerary: Trek Yak Kharka, Thorong Phedi/High Camp
Fly Jomsom-Pokhara or trek/drive down via Tatopani/Ghorepani.
transportation: Bus/Jeep Ktm to start point. Flight Jomsom-Pokhara (~$125) or Bus/Jeep from end points.

name: Langtang Valley Trek
description: Relatively short trek near Kathmandu into the beautiful Langtang Valley, offering views of Langtang Lirung and chances to explore Tamang culture. Ends at Kyanjin Gompa.
historical_significance: Tamang culture with Tibetan origins. Kyanjin Gompa monastery. Valley heavily impacted by 2015 earthquake but rebuilt.
transportation: Bus/Jeep Ktm-Syabrubesi.

name: Ghorepani Poon Hill Trek
description: Popular short trek known for spectacular sunrise views over Annapurna and Dhaulagiri ranges from Poon Hill. Passes through Gurung villages and rhododendron forests.
historical_significance: Traverses traditional Gurung villages.
transportation: Bus/Taxi Pokhara to Nayapul.

name: Gokyo Lakes Trek
description: Stunning trek focusing on the series of turquoise glacial lakes in the Gokyo Valley, with panoramic views including Everest from Gokyo Ri.
historical_significance: Part of the traditional Sherpa homeland, features summer pasture settlements (yersa).
itinerary: Divert from Namche towards Dole, Machhermo
Return via same route or cross Renjo La pass (longer)
transportation: Flight Ktm-Lukla (~$400+ RT).
nearby_attractions: Possibility to cross Renjo La or Cho La passes
required_permits: Khumbu Pasang Lhamu Rural Municipality Fee

name: Three Passes Trek

elevation_profile.max_elevation: 5,545m (Kala Patthar), Passes: Kongma La(5,535m), Cho La(5,420m), Renjo La(5,360m)

description: The ultimate Everest circuit, crossing three challenging high passes (Kongma La, Cho La, Renjo La) linking the EBC, Gokyo, and Thame valleys. Demands excellent fitness and acclimatization.
historical_significance: Covers major valleys of the Khumbu region, offering comprehensive cultural and geographical exposure.
itinerary: Typically anti-clockwise: Lukla -> Namche -> Chukhung -> Kongma La -> Lobuche -> EBC/Kala Patthar -> Dzongla -> Cho La -> Gokyo -> Renjo La -> Thame -> Namche -> Lukla
transportation: Flight Ktm-Lukla (~$400+ RT).
required_permits: Khumbu Pasang Lhamu Rural Municipality Fee
recommended_gear: As per EBC + Microspikes/crampons often useful for passes

safety_info.altitude_sickness_risk: Very High - Careful acclimatization and contingency days vital.

name: Everest View Trek
description: A shorter trek providing classic views of Everest, Lhotse, and Ama Dablam without ascending to extreme altitudes. Ideal for those with limited time.
historical_significance: Visits key Sherpa hubs like Namche Bazaar and Tengboche monastery.
itinerary: Day 3: Hike to Everest View Hotel/Khumjung
transportation: Flight Ktm-Lukla (~$400+ RT).
required_permits: Khumbu Pasang Lhamu Rural Municipality Fee

name: Mardi Himal Trek
description: Ridge trek offering spectacular close-up views of Mardi Himal, Machhapuchhre, Annapurna South, and Hiunchuli. Less crowded than ABC or Poon Hill.
historical_significance: Follows a less-trodden path, offering glimpses into quieter village life.
itinerary: Trek Australian Camp/Pothana, Forest Camp, Low Camp, High Camp
Day trip to Mardi Himal Base Camp (West)
Return via Low Camp, Siding village

cost_breakdown.accommodation: $5-$10/night (teahouse, can be basic at high camp)

transportation: Taxi/Bus Pokhara to Kande/Phedi (start). Jeep from Siding/Lumle (end).

name: Khopra Danda Trek
description: Community lodge-based trek offering stunning panoramic views of Dhaulagiri and Annapurna ranges from Khopra Ridge. Features an optional challenging day hike to sacred Khayer Lake.
historical_significance: Supports local community-run lodges, promotes sustainable tourism.
itinerary: Optional day hike to Khayer Lake
transportation: Bus/Taxi Pokhara to start point. Bus/Jeep from end points (e.g., Tatopani, Beni, Nayapul).
nearby_attractions: Can connect with Poon Hill / Annapurna Circuit routes

safety_info.altitude_sickness_risk: Moderate (High if hiking to Khayer Lake)

name: Tamang Heritage Trail
description: Cultural trek focusing on Tamang heritage, villages (Gatlang, Thuman, Briddim), monasteries, and hot springs, with views of Langtang and Ganesh Himal.
historical_significance: Showcases unique Tamang culture, architecture, and hospitality.
transportation: Bus/Jeep Ktm-Syabrubesi.

name: Gosainkunda Trek
description: Pilgrimage trek to the sacred alpine lakes of Gosainkunda, revered by Hindus (associated with Lord Shiva) and Buddhists. Can cross Lauribina La pass.
historical_significance: Major pilgrimage site, especially during Janai Purnima festival in August.
itinerary: Return via same route OR cross Lauribina La pass to Ghopte/Tharepati (connects to Helambu)
transportation: Bus/Jeep Ktm-Dhunche.

name: Helambu Trek
description: Short circuit trek near Kathmandu Valley, known for its Hyolmo Sherpa culture, monasteries, apple orchards, and scenic forests. Lower altitude.
historical_significance: Home to the Hyolmo people, with distinct culture and traditions. Ancient monasteries.
itinerary: Trek down to Melamchi Pul Bazaar

cost_breakdown.permits: Shivapuri Nagarjun NP (NPR 1000), Langtang NP (NPR 3000 - if crossing Tharepati), TIMS (NPR 1000/2000)

transportation: Bus/Taxi Ktm-Sundarijal (start). Bus from Melamchi Pul (end).

name: Ama Dablam Base Camp Trek
description: Trek focusing on the stunningly beautiful Ama Dablam peak, leading to its base camp. Follows the main EBC trail initially.
historical_significance: Ama Dablam ('Mother's Necklace') is culturally significant and visually dominant in the Khumbu.
itinerary: Divert towards Ama Dablam Base Camp
Return via Pangboche, Namche to Lukla
transportation: Flight Ktm-Lukla (~$400+ RT).
required_permits: Khumbu Pasang Lhamu Rural Municipality Fee

name: Arun Valley Trek
duration: 15-20 days (can connect to Makalu BC or Everest region)
description: A culturally rich trek through the deep Arun Valley, home to Rai and Sherpa communities. Less frequented, offering diverse ecosystems from lowlands to alpine zones. Often used as an approach to Makalu Base Camp or a lower-altitude route towards the Everest region.
historical_significance: Traverses areas inhabited by diverse ethnic groups with unique traditions. Historically significant trade route.
itinerary: Trek through Chewa Besi, Gothe Bazar, Salpa Phedi
Options to exit via Phaplu/Salleri or link towards Lukla/Makalu

cost_breakdown.permits: Makalu Barun NP (NPR 3000) required if entering park area. TIMS card.

transportation: Flight Ktm-Tumlingtar (~$150 one-way). Exit potentially via Phaplu flight or long bus journey.
required_permits: Makalu Barun National Park Permit (if applicable)

safety_info.altitude_sickness_risk: Low to Moderate depending on route/passes.

name: Pikey Peak Trek
description: Relatively new trek offering arguably some of the best wide panoramic views of the Everest range (from Makalu to Dhaulagiri on clear days) without extreme altitude. Known for Sherpa culture and rhododendron forests.
historical_significance: Pikey Peak is considered a sacred clan protector deity by local Sherpas. Route passes through traditional Sherpa villages.
itinerary: Trek to Pikey Peak Base Camp

cost_breakdown.permits: TIMS Card. No national park fee generally required.

transportation: Jeep Ktm-Dhap (start). Fly Phaplu-Ktm or long jeep ride Salleri-Ktm (end).

name: Rolwaling Valley Trek
duration: 15-22 days (longer if crossing Tashi Lapcha pass)

elevation_profile.max_elevation: Approx 4,700m (Tsho Rolpa Lake), 5,755m (Tashi Lapcha pass - technical)

description: A remote and challenging trek into the secluded Rolwaling Valley, west of the Khumbu. Features stunning landscapes, Sherpa villages, Tsho Rolpa glacial lake, and views of Mt. Gaurishankar. Crossing the Tashi Lapcha pass to enter the Khumbu is a technical mountaineering challenge.
historical_significance: Rolwaling is believed to be a 'beyul' (hidden sacred valley). Home to traditional Sherpa communities.
itinerary: Trek through Simigaon, Beding, Na village
Return via same route OR attempt technical Tashi Lapcha pass crossing (requires climbing gear, permits, experienced team) to reach Thame in Khumbu.

cost_breakdown.permits: Gaurishankar Conservation Area Permit (GCAP - NPR 3000), TIMS. Rolwaling RAP may apply depending on route/pass crossing ($20/week approx - verify). Tashi Lapcha climbing permit required for pass.
cost_breakdown.accommodation: Basic teahouses, likely requires camping, especially near lake/pass.

transportation: Bus/Jeep Ktm to start point. Fly Phaplu-Ktm or long trek/drive (end, typical) or long trek back to Jiri/Salleri
recommended_gear: Climbing gear (ropes, ice axe, crampons, harness) if crossing Tashi Lapcha

safety_info.altitude_sickness_risk: High to Very High (especially if crossing pass). Remote area, limited rescue access. Technical hazards on pass.

name: Dudh Kunda Trek
description: Trek to the sacred 'Milk Lake' (Dudh Kunda) situated at the base of Numbur Himal. A less-crowded pilgrimage route through Sherpa villages and rhododendron forests.
historical_significance: Dudh Kunda is a sacred lake for both Hindus and Buddhists; major festival held in August.
itinerary: Return via similar or slightly different route to Phaplu/Salleri

cost_breakdown.permits: TIMS Card. May require local fee, check status.
cost_breakdown.accommodation: Basic teahouses/homestays, potential camping near lake.

transportation: Flight Ktm-Phaplu or long jeep ride Ktm-Salleri/Ringmo.
nearby_attractions: Thubten Choling Monastery (near Junbesi, possible detour)

name: Jiri to Everest Base Camp Trek
description: The classic 'pioneer's route' to Everest Base Camp, starting with a bus ride to Jiri and trekking through the lower hills before joining the main trail from Lukla. Offers more cultural immersion and gradual acclimatization.
historical_significance: This was the original route used by expeditions before the Lukla airstrip was built.
itinerary: Trek through Bhandar, Sete, Junbesi, Nunthala, Bupsa
Join main EBC trail near Phakding/Chheplung
Continue EBC trek as per standard route
Fly back Lukla-Ktm or trek back to Jiri/Salleri

cost_breakdown.permits: GCAP (if starting Jiri), Sagarmatha NP, Khumbu Municipality Fee, TIMS

transportation: Bus Ktm-Jiri (start). Flight Lukla-Ktm (end, typical) or long trek/drive out.
required_permits: Gaurishankar Conservation Area Permit (if starting Jiri)
Khumbu Pasang Lhamu Rural Municipality Fee

safety_info.altitude_sickness_risk: High - Gradual ascent helps, but still significant.

name: Annapurna Base Camp Trek
description: Iconic trek into the heart of the Annapurna Sanctuary, a natural amphitheater surrounded by towering peaks including Annapurna I, Machhapuchhre, and Hiunchuli.
historical_significance: The Sanctuary is considered sacred by the local Gurung people.
itinerary: Return via Jhinu Danda (hot springs), Siwai/Nayapul
transportation: Bus/Taxi Pokhara to Nayapul/Siwai.

safety_info.altitude_sickness_risk: Moderate-High. Avalanche risk in certain seasons/areas - heed local advice.

name: Tilicho Lake Trek
description: A side trip from the Annapurna Circuit leading to the stunningly beautiful, high-altitude Tilicho Lake, one of the highest lakes in the world. Requires extra acclimatization and traverses landslide-prone areas.
historical_significance: Tilicho Lake holds religious significance for Hindus (mentioned in Ramayana). Area is part of the traditional Manangi homeland.
itinerary: Follow Annapurna Circuit route to Manang
Side Trip: Trek Khangsar, Tilicho Base Camp
Continue Annapurna Circuit over Thorong La Pass
transportation: Same as Annapurna Circuit.
nearby_attractions: Views of Tilicho Peak and Gangapurna
recommended_gear: Good balance needed for landslide sections

safety_info.altitude_sickness_risk: High. Landslide risk on trail to Tilicho Base Camp - check conditions.

name: Nar Phu Valley Trek

elevation_profile.max_elevation: 5,416m (Thorong La Pass if combined), 5,320m (Kang La Pass)

description: Trek into the remote and culturally distinct Nar and Phu valleys north of the main Annapurna Circuit route. Requires restricted area permits and offers a glimpse into ancient Tibetan-influenced culture and stunning, rugged landscapes. Often involves crossing the high Kang La pass.
historical_significance: Nar and Phu villages retain unique dialects and traditions due to isolation. Ancient monasteries like Phu Gompa.
itinerary: Follow Annapurna Circuit route to Koto
Enter Nar Phu valley via Meta, Kyang
Cross Kang La pass (5,320m) to Ngawal OR return via same route
Rejoin Annapurna Circuit and continue over Thorong La or exit

cost_breakdown.permits: Nar Phu RAP ($100/week Sep-Nov, $75/week other; + daily fees), ACAP (NPR 3000), TIMS (NPR 1000/2000)

transportation: Same as Annapurna Circuit start/end.
nearby_attractions: Views of Himlung Himal, Ratna Chuli

safety_info.altitude_sickness_risk: Very High. Remote area. Requires minimum 2 trekkers + licensed guide.

name: Jomsom Muktinath Trek
best_seasons: September-November (can be done in monsoon, less rain)
description: Trek through the Kali Gandaki Valley, the world's deepest gorge, in the rain-shadow area of Lower Mustang. Features arid landscapes, Tibetan-influenced culture, the sacred Muktinath temple, and strong winds.
historical_significance: Ancient salt trade route. Muktinath is sacred to Hindus & Buddhists. Kagbeni is gateway to Upper Mustang.
itinerary: Trek back to Jomsom via Lupra (optional Bon village) OR trek down valley towards Marpha, Tatopani
Fly Jomsom-Pokhara or take bus/jeep from Jomsom/Beni.
transportation: Flight Pokhara-Jomsom (~$125 one-way). Bus/Jeep available Jomsom-Pokhara (long journey).

safety_info.altitude_sickness_risk: Low-Moderate (if flying in, take it easy first day). Strong winds common in afternoon.

name: Sikles Trek
description: A short cultural trek through Gurung villages, rhododendron forests, and terraced fields northeast of Pokhara. Offers good views of Annapurna II, IV, and Lamjung Himal. Less crowded than Poon Hill.
historical_significance: Sikles is one of the largest Gurung villages in Nepal, known for preserving traditional culture and architecture.
transportation: Bus/Jeep Pokhara to starting point (e.g., Bhurjung Khola). Jeep/Bus from ending point.

name: Royal Trek
description: A short, low-altitude trek named after Prince Charles trekked this route in the 1980s. Offers pleasant walks through villages and terraced fields with views of the Annapurnas.
historical_significance: Gained fame due to the royal visit. Passes through diverse ethnic villages.
itinerary: Trek Yak Kharka, Thorong Phedi/High Camp
Fly Jomsom-Pokhara or trek/drive down via Tatopani/Ghorepani.
transportation: Bus/Taxi Ktm to start point. Bus from end points (e.g., Tatopani, Beni, Nayapul).

name: Langtang Gosainkunda Helambu Trek
description: A comprehensive trek combining the Langtang Valley, sacred Gosainkunda lakes, and the culturally rich Helambu region.
historical_significance: Combines Tamang, Hyolmo cultures, and major pilgrimage sites.
itinerary: From Thulo Syabru/Sing Gompa, trek towards Gosainkunda
Descend into Helambu region via Ghopte, Tharepati
Follow Helambu Trek itinerary down to Sundarijal/Melamchi

cost_breakdown.permits: Langtang NP (NPR 3000), Shivapuri Nagarjun NP (NPR 1000), TIMS (NPR 1000/2000)

transportation: Bus/Jeep Ktm-Syabrubesi (start). Bus from Melamchi/Taxi from Sundarijal (end).
